call_title: Ergo PoW Blockchain (EDIT) - Community Chat - September 11th

topics.title: Community AMA Format and Attendance
topics.summary: Introduction to the weekly community AMA format where all participants can ask questions or be asked questions. Discussion of Odi taking over Sigmanauts Twitter account and infrastructure updates including Ergo bots coming back online and plans to move ergoplatform.org hosting to community infrastructure.

topics.title: Node 6.0 and Sub-blocks Development
topics.summary: Development update on Ergo Node 6.0 changes and sub-blocks implementation. Testing is being conducted on DevNet with extreme parameters - 30-second blocks with 60 sub-blocks per block, creating 2 sub-blocks per second for intensive testing.

topics.title: GitCircles Project and Community Currencies
topics.summary: Overview of GitCircles project creating community currencies for development communities where developers receive tokens for repository contributions. The project includes Git bot, persistence layer, and plans for GitHub application integration.

topics.title: DAO Governance in Open Source Development
topics.summary: Discussion on whether on-chain DAOs should govern open source projects, comparing existing off-chain governance structures like Linux and Bitcoin development. Debate over Bitcoin's ossification and inability to implement changes due to governance issues.

topics.title: MindHealer Marketing and Crypto Adoption Challenges
topics.summary: Dmitriy discusses challenges marketing MindHealer due to crypto stigma and proposes using travel bloggers as ambassadors to showcase Ergo's utility for cross-border payments and decentralized money usage, similar to Roger Ver's early Bitcoin promotion.

topics.title: Influencer Marketing Strategy Discussion
topics.summary: Debate over targeting crypto KOLs versus ordinary people for Ergo adoption. Discussion includes the high costs of crypto influencers and preference for targeting non-crypto communities like developers and travelers who need decentralized money solutions.

topics.title: Accessibility Issues for New Ergo Users
topics.summary: Ben highlights the complexity barrier for new Ergo users, describing the multi-step process required to participate in Ergo raffles. Discussion of potential solutions including Apple Pay integration and GoFundMe-style fiat donation options alongside crypto options.

topics.title: Real-World Crypto Usability Challenges
topics.summary: Discussion of crypto's practical limitations for everyday use and the need for user-friendly applications. Ben emphasizes that products like Tabi POS represent real-world utility that regular users can understand, unlike complex DeFi applications.

topics.title: Security Updates and Spam Token Protection
topics.summary: Update on Nautilus wallet security features including spam token filtering and plans to integrate community-maintained scammer address lists. Discussion of recent fake token airdrops and community-driven spam protection measures.

topics.title: Autolykos DAO and Colorado Meetup Announcements
topics.summary: Grayman promotes the Autolykos DAO venture capital collective with upcoming Sow Round and payment gateway development. QX announces Colorado meetup on October 11th with live streaming and community breakfast.
